metadata.title: Assessment Plan for RHEL 9 based on ISA/IEC 62443-4-2 (SL-4 Target)

components.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9
components.description: The target of this assessment is the production RHEL 9 hosts used for industrial control system applications.

parts.name: rules-of-engagement
parts.prose: This assessment will be conducted during normal business hours. No disruptive testing will be performed without prior written consent from the system owner.

control-selections.description: All controls implemented by the RHEL 9 component as defined in the component definition.

assessment-assets.description: The assets used to perform this assessment.

tasks.title: Assess FR 1: Identification and Authentication Control
Assess FR 6: Timely Response to Events

activities.title: Verify Human User Identification and Authentication
activities.description: Verify that RHEL 9 is configured to uniquely identify and authenticate all human users with multifactor authentication.

steps.description: Examine the `/etc/sssd/sssd.conf` and relevant PAM configuration files in `/etc/pam.d/` to confirm integration with an enterprise identity provider that enforces MFA.
Interview the Linux administration team to confirm that all user access is managed through the central identity provider.
Test the login process by attempting to SSH into a target host with a test user account, and verify that an MFA challenge is presented and required for successful login.

activities.title: Verify Strength of Password-based Authentication
activities.description: Verify that strong password quality rules are enforced.

steps.description: Examine the `/etc/security/pwquality.conf` file to confirm that minimum length, complexity, and history requirements are set to strong values.

activities.title: Verify Unsuccessful Login Attempts
activities.description: Verify that accounts are locked after consecutive failed login attempts.

steps.description: Examine the PAM configuration to ensure the `pam_faillock.so` module is active and configured with a low threshold for failures.
Test the lockout policy by attempting to SSH with an incorrect password multiple times and verifying that the account is locked.

activities.title: Verify System Use Notification
activities.description: Verify a warning banner is displayed upon login.

steps.description: Examine the contents of the `/etc/issue.net` file to confirm it contains the approved system use notification text.

activities.title: Verify Authorization Enforcement
activities.description: Verify that RHEL 9 enforces authorization for all users based on the principle of least privilege.

steps.description: Examine the `/etc/sudoers` file and files in `/etc/sudoers.d/` to verify that administrative privileges are granted to groups, not individual users, and that passwordless sudo is disabled.
Test the sudo configuration by logging in as a non-privileged user and attempting to run a command that requires root privileges. Verify the action is denied.

activities.title: Verify Mobile Code Control
activities.description: Verify that only signed packages from trusted sources can be installed.

steps.description: Examine the `/etc/dnf/dnf.conf` file to ensure that `gpgcheck=1` is set, enforcing signature validation for all package operations.

activities.title: Verify Auditable Events
activities.description: Verify that the audit daemon is configured to log all security-relevant events.

steps.description: Examine the audit rules in `/etc/audit/rules.d/` to confirm that they cover critical events such as file access, system calls, and administrative actions.

activities.title: Verify Protection from Malicious Code
activities.description: Verify that SELinux is active and in enforcing mode.

steps.description: Test the system by running the `sestatus` command and verifying that SELinux is in 'enforcing' mode.

activities.title: Verify Security Functionality Verification
activities.description: Verify that OpenSCAP is used for automated compliance scanning.

steps.description: Examine the system's cron jobs or systemd timers to confirm that OpenSCAP scans are scheduled to run on a regular basis.

activities.title: Verify Software and Information Integrity
activities.description: Verify that AIDE is configured for file integrity monitoring.

steps.description: Examine the `/etc/aide.conf` file to confirm that it is monitoring critical system files and directories.
Test the AIDE configuration by running `aide --check` and verifying that it reports on any intentional or unintentional file changes.

activities.title: Verify Information Confidentiality
activities.description: Verify that the system's disks are encrypted.

steps.description: Test the system by running `lsblk -f` and verifying that the root filesystem is of type 'crypto_LUKS'.

activities.title: Verify Use of Cryptography
activities.description: Verify that the system is running in FIPS mode.

steps.description: Test the system by running `fips-mode-setup --check` and verifying that FIPS mode is enabled.

activities.title: Verify Network Segmentation
activities.description: Verify that the host-based firewall is configured with a default-deny policy.

steps.description: Examine the output of `firewall-cmd --list-all` to confirm that the default zone is set to 'drop' or 'reject' and that only necessary services are explicitly allowed.

activities.title: Verify Audit Log Accessibility
activities.description: Verify that audit logs are being forwarded to a central SIEM.

steps.description: Examine the `/etc/rsyslog.conf` file and files in `/etc/rsyslog.d/` to confirm that audit logs are being forwarded to the correct SIEM address.

activities.title: Verify Continuous Monitoring
activities.description: Verify that the audit service is active.

steps.description: Test the system by running `systemctl is-active auditd` and verifying that the service is running.

activities.title: Verify Denial of Service Protection
activities.description: Verify that resource limits are configured for services.

steps.description: Examine the systemd unit files for critical services to confirm that they are assigned to a resource-limited slice and have appropriate CPU and memory quotas set.

activities.title: Verify Least Functionality
activities.description: Verify that unnecessary packages are removed and services are disabled.

steps.description: Test the system by running `rpm -q <package_name>` for a list of unnecessary packages and verifying they are not installed.
Test the system by running `systemctl is-enabled <service_name>` for a list of unnecessary services and verifying they are disabled.

activities.title: Verify Control System Component Inventory
activities.description: Verify that a software inventory is available.

steps.description: Test the system by running `rpm -qa` to generate a complete list of all installed software packages.
